title.narrative: Food Security and Poverty Alleviation in the Midland Province, Zimbabwe

description.narrative: This project will be carried out in four districts in the Midlands Province of Zimbabwe, namely Kwekwe, Gweru, Shurugwi and Mberengwa. The project will improve the lives of 5,520 smallholder farm families, including members of vulnerable groups such as children, the elderly, women, youth, and people living with or affected by HIV/AIDS. With funding from the European Commission, Heifer International Zimbabwe will help improve the food security of the target groups through increased food production and household income; reduce environmental degradation through the promotion of environmentally-friendly livelihood practices; and increase the resilience of the target groups by strengthening their capacity for socio-economic action. Of the 1,440 original participant families, 720 will receive poultry, 480 will receive goats, and 240 will receive cattle. An additional 4,080 families will benefit from Heifer’s Pass on the Gift process. Heifer Zimbabwe will provide training on livestock husbandry and establish support services for livestock production. Participants will be trained on and will adopt manure management and use, draught power use, enterprise development and linking farmers to markets, fuel-efficient stoves, woodlots and orchard management, environmentally-friendly grazing and feeding management, sustainable environmental use and management, leadership and group management, and establishment of group committees. The project will also provide leadership and training on HIV/AIDS and gender issues.
